newsitem.title: USA: US March same-store retail sales up 2.1 pct-report.
newsitem.headline: US March same-store retail sales up 2.1 pct-report.

text.p: Same-store sales for U.S. retail stores rose 2.1 percent in March from a year earlier, according to data compiled by First Data Corp's TeleCheck Services Inc unit.

Consumer spending may have been tempered by heavy publicity about rising interest rates and the impact of higher rates on consumers with adjustable-rate mortgages and other variable-rate debt, according to TeleCheck's senior economic adviser, William Ford.
Sales rose 4.9 percent in the Southwest, 3.3 percent in the Southeast, 2.8 percent in the Midwest, 1.6 percent in the Mid-Atlantic, and 1.2 percent in the West, TeleCheck said.
The TeleCheck Retail Index is based on a year-over-year, same-store comparison of the dollar volume of checks written by consumers at more than 27,000 locations.
